perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Buyer has designated Backhaul as a Buyer Designee for purposes of the Asset Purchase Agreement, and Buyer has assigned to Backhaul the right to receive the Purchased Assets pursuant to that certain Assignment of Asset Purchase Agreement between Buyer and Backhaul dated as of the date hereof.

ASSIGNMENT:

NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged, Seller does hereby transfer, sell, assign, convey and deliver to Backhaul all right, title and interest in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property, including, without limitation, the Trademarks and Patents set forth on Schedules A and B hereof, respectively, and all goodwill of the Purchased Business associated therewith.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Buyer has designated Backhaul as a Buyer Designee for purposes of the Asset Purchase Agreement, and Buyer has assigned to Backhaul the right to potentially receive some of the Purchased Assets pursuant to that certain Assignment of Asset Purchase Agreement between Buyer and Backhaul dated as of the date hereof.

ASSIGNMENT:

NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged, Seller may transfer, sell, assign, convey and deliver to Backhaul some right, title and interest in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property, potentially including the Trademarks and Patents set forth on Schedules A and B hereof, respectively, and potentially some goodwill of the Purchased Business associated therewith.
perturbation.explanation: The original text definitively states that Backhaul has the right to receive Purchased Assets and that Seller transfers all right, title, and interest in the Assigned Intellectual Property. The modified text introduces uncertainty by stating Backhaul might receive 'some' assets and the seller 'may' transfer 'some' rights, thereby contradicting the initial definitive statements and creating ambiguity about the extent of the assignment.

perturbation.original_text: Seller hereby covenants and agrees, that from time to time forthwith upon the reasonable written request of Backhaul or Buyer, that Seller will, at Backhaul's cost and expense, do, execute, acknowledge and deliver or cause to be done, executed, acknowledged and delivered, each and all of such further acts, deeds, assignments, transfers, conveyances and assurances as may reasonably be required by Backhaul or Buyer in order to transfer, assign, convey and deliver unto and vest in Backhaul title to all right, title and interest of Seller in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text: Seller hereby covenants and agrees, that from time to time forthwith upon the reasonable written request of Backhaul or Buyer, that Seller may, at Backhaul's cost and expense, attempt to do, execute, acknowledge and deliver or cause to be done, executed, acknowledged and delivered, such further acts, deeds, assignments, transfers, conveyances and assurances as may be requested by Backhaul or Buyer in order to potentially transfer, assign, convey and deliver unto and vest in Backhaul some title to some right of Seller in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the seller 'will' take actions to transfer all rights to the intellectual property. The modified text replaces 'will' with 'may' and changes 'all right, title, and interest' to 'some title to some right,' creating a contradiction. This makes the obligation to transfer uncertain and introduces ambiguity as to what extent the intellectual property rights are actually being transferred.

perturbation.original_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement is subject in all respects to the terms and conditions of the Asset Purchase Agreement and is intended only to document the assignment of the Assigned Intellectual Property. Nothing contained in this Intellectual Property Agreement shall be deemed to supersede any of the obligations, agreements, representations, covenants or warranties of Seller and Buyer contained in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement is subject in certain respects to some of the terms and conditions of the Asset Purchase Agreement and is potentially intended to document the assignment of some of the Assigned Intellectual Property. Certain items contained in this Intellectual Property Agreement may supersede some of the obligations, agreements, representations, covenants or warranties of Seller and Buyer contained in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the IP agreement is subject to the Asset Purchase Agreement and doesn't supersede it, fully documenting the assignment. The changed text contradicts this by saying the IP agreement is subject in 'certain respects,' 'potentially intended' to document only 'some' of the IP, and 'may supersede' some of the obligations of the original agreement. This creates uncertainty about the relationship between the agreements and the completeness of the assignment.
